com.bigdata.rdf.graph.impl.util

Class GASRunnerBase.OptionData

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bigdata.rdf.graph.impl.util.GASRunnerBase.OptionData
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BigdataGASRunner.BigdataOptionData, RAMGASRunner.RAMOptionData, SAILGASRunner.SAILOptionData
    Enclosing class:
    GASRunnerBase<VS,ES,ST>

    protected class GASRunnerBase.OptionData
extends Object
    Configured options for the GASRunner.
    Author:
    Bryan Thompson

      • seed

        public long seed
        The seed used for the random number generator (default ).

      • r

        public Random r
        Random number generated used for sampling the starting vertices. Set by #init().

      • nruns

        public int nruns
        The #of runs per initial condition. For algorithms that use a single starting vertex (BFS, SSSP, etc.), there will be a total of nruns * nsamples runs. For algorithms that populate the initial frontier with all vertices (e.g., CC, PR), there will be a total of nruns.

      • nsamples

        public int nsamples
        The #of random starting vertices to use for algorithms that use a single starting vertex in the initial frontier and otherwise ignored.

      • nthreads

        public int nthreads
        The #of threads to use for GATHER and SCATTER operators.

      • analyticClass

        public Class<IGASProgram<VS,ES,ST>> analyticClass
        The analytic class to be executed.

      • schedulerClassOverride

        public Class<IGASSchedulerImpl> schedulerClassOverride
        The IGASSchedulerImpl class to use. TODO Override or always? If always, then where to get the default?

      • loadSet

        public final LinkedHashSet<String> loadSet
        Set of files to load (may be empty).

      • propertyFile

        public String propertyFile
        The name of the implementation specific configuration file.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Shutdown any resources, including the connection to the backend.

        Note: This method must be safe. It may be called if init() fails. It may be called more than once.

      • handleArg

        public boolean handleArg(AtomicInteger i,
                String[] args)
        Return trueiff one or more arguments can be parsed starting at the specified index.
        Parameters:
        i - The index into the arguments.
        args - The arguments.
        Returns:
        true iff any arguments were recognized.

        msg - The optional message
